It's a story about 3 people who went for a run. This is a story about Kobi, Ram and Naomi. On October 7th at 6 in the morning, the three friends met in their sports clothes, took a selfie for the running group and set off. After 4 kilometers a rocket barrage began, they took… https://t.co/2XQp5T4QeC https://t.co/y1aRuWWYu4

note_tweet.text: It's a story about 3 people who went for a run. This is a story about Kobi, Ram and Naomi. On October 7th at 6 in the morning, the three friends met in their sports clothes, took a selfie for the running group and set off. After 4 kilometers a rocket barrage began, they took cover when suddenly they began to hear gunfire and shouts of "Allah Akbar" near them. They found a large pipe, approached it and covered themselves with leaves. Suddenly an armed terrorist ran towards them, a frightened Kobi started running, the terrorist shot at him and he fell. Within minutes, ten terrorists arrived on the scene and began looking for civilians to murder in their surroundings, imagine, for 5 hours the three lay on the ground when suddenly they heard IDF soldiers, "We are civilians" Ram signaled to them, but the soldiers could not rescue them from there and asked them to continue hiding. 2  Soldiers stayed behind to secure them and the others promised to return soon. Suddenly a loud gunshot was heard, and a shootout ensued, the terrorists threw grenades, all were wounded and fell to the ground. A terrorist arrived at the scene, the bleeding Kobi tried to run away again, a burst of gunfire rang out and Kobi screamed and fell. Another terrorist arrived at the scene He fired another burst, hitting Ram and immediately after that, hitting Naomi, who was next to him. Ram lay on his stomach, his face in the sand, his back covered in blood, and waited for his death. One of the wounded soldiers managed to shoot and eliminate the terrorists, but for Kobi and Naomi it was too late. Half an hour later, A soldier who passed by and saw the injured Ram took him to the hospital ,Ram is the only survivor. This is a story about 3 friends who always ran together and on October 7th it was their last run. In the photos: the selfie before the run, and the last photo, Naomi and Ram hiding from monsters.

The Hamas-run Gaza Ministry of Health claims 22,000 Palestinians have died in this war.  Israel says it has killed ~9,000 Hamas terrorists.

Stephanie Simon, Harvard’s Dean for Communications and Strategic Initiatives acknowledged the student body’s association with Hamas, but said it has not affected its program. She referred to Hamas as a major political party.

“Student government elections at Birzeit typically involve candidates affiliated with each of the major political parties in the region, including Hamas,” she said. “These student government elections are not germane to and have not affected the FXB Center’s work with the scholars and students at Birzeit’s Institute of Community and Public Health.”

data.text:
Birzeit’s students voted for a Hamas-affiliated bloc for its student government for a second year in a row in May. 

The Islamic Bloc won 25 of the 51 seats with 4,481 votes in the race that had a 77% voter turnout. 

The Bloc said its victory proves students favor “the option of… https://t.co/pkAbeaUcBQ https://t.co/UxaP1GnXeE

note_tweet.text:
Birzeit’s students voted for a Hamas-affiliated bloc for its student government for a second year in a row in May. 

The Islamic Bloc won 25 of the 51 seats with 4,481 votes in the race that had a 77% voter turnout. 

The Bloc said its victory proves students favor “the option of resistance” against Israel, and disapprove of the Palestinian Authority’s policies.

The “Palestine Social Medicine Course” is a “three-week intensive summer course is designed to introduce students to the social, structural, political, and historical aspects that determine Palestinian health beyond the biological basis of disease.” 

The curriculum content will include hearing from health practitioners, academics, and activists about various topics including “Settler colonialism and its manifestations in Palestine” and “Health and racism,” the website adds.

note_tweet.text:
Stephanie Simon, Harvard’s Dean for Communications and Strategic Initiatives acknowledged the student body’s association with Hamas, but said it has not affected its program. She referred to Hamas as a major political party.

“Student government elections at Birzeit typically involve candidates affiliated with each of the major political parties in the region, including Hamas,” she said. “These student government elections are not germane to and have not affected the FXB Center’s work with the scholars and students at Birzeit’s Institute of Community and Public Health.”

In September, the student government president, Abdulmajid Hassan, and seven other students were arrested by the Israel Defense Forces. Some of the students confessed to planning a terror attack.

One of the co-directors of Harvard’s program condemned the raid during a webinar about the trip. 

“We condemn the Israeli raid of Birzeit University on September 24th and stand in solidarity with our colleagues at Birzeit University,” David Mills said. “These raids violate the right of Palestinians to education, freedom of speech, and freedom of association.”

note_tweet.text:
Birzeit’s students voted for a Hamas-affiliated bloc for its student government for a second year in a row in May. 

The Islamic Bloc won 25 of the 51 seats with 4,481 votes in the race that had a 77% voter turnout. 

The Bloc said its victory proves students favor “the option of resistance” against Israel, and disapprove of the Palestinian Authority’s policies.

note_tweet.text:
The “Palestine Social Medicine Course” is a “three-week intensive summer course is designed to introduce students to the social, structural, political, and historical aspects that determine Palestinian health beyond the biological basis of disease.” 

The curriculum content will include hearing from health practitioners, academics, and activists about various topics including “Settler colonialism and its manifestations in Palestine” and “Health and racism,” the website adds.
